Message.Title: GOOG is winning vs. APPLE
Message.Msg: But GOOG should be careful to not overdo it. Since Apple is needed in the business still, to keep alternative asking prices for iPHONES...etc. high.

Message.Title: GOOG Still holding
Message.Msg: This is encouraging. Even with the indices down big all week, even with AAPL pulling the NASDAQ down big, GOOG is STILL holding. Pre Q2 this would have been down to the 550 level under such circumstances. If we can get a few up days it should be up nicely from here. Only my opinion. Which doesn't count for much.

7/25/2012 Apple's sales from greater China, which includes Taiwan and Hong Kong, totaled $5.7 billion for its third quarter ended June, an unexpectedly steep drop of $2.2 billion from the January-March period. Apple's rivals swoop as iPhone China sales flag Reuters – 3 hours ago By Lee Chyen Yee and Melanie Lee HONG KONG/SHANGHAI (Reuters) - Apple Inc's disappointing China sales suggest that its customers will not always wait for the next iPhone when rivals such as Samsung have plenty of flashy new models available now, analysts and resellers said on Wednesday. China is Apple's second-largest market, and its rabid fans have been known to seek out smugglers just to get their hands on the latest gadgets before they officially go on sale in Beijing and Shanghai stores.

Message.Title: GOOG vs FB
Message.Msg: GOOG may be best way to play FB after earnings. If FB goes up - GOOG goes up in sympathy; if FB declines; GOOG still goes up because pundits will say GOOG+ taking business away from FB. Either way, it is a win-win for GOOG and too much risk for holding FB short term.

Message.Title: GOOG About to lose huge court case to VRNG over search patents imho
Message.Msg: you guys should read up on VRNG. they own the patents around sorting search ads and search returns using user behavior. Googles whole business is based on these patents so GOOG has to settle or they could lose $5-$10 billion or more. Trial starts in Oct and pre-trial stuff went in VRNG favor. VRNG is about to completely disrupt Google. founder of lycos is behind the patent and is coo of vrng

symbol: VRGN Google Settlement Could Drive Vringo Shares Above $30 July 23, 2012 For those of you new to this story, Vringo is suing Google (GOOG), AOL (AOL), Gannett (GCI), Target (TGT), and IAC (IACI) for patent infringement. There's a good chance Microsoft (MSFT), Yahoo (YHOO), and many other tech giants will be facing Vringo lawsuits also. To keep things simple, this article focuses on the Google lawsuit. Based on the outcome of the recent Markman hearing as well as other factors that I will elaborate on below, I believe that Google will either settle pretrial, or Vringo will prevail in court on October 16th, 2012. I began my Vringo journey earlier this year when I received a call from an investment banker who recommended I buy shares in the company. Since this was the same banker who suggested I buy VirnetX (VHC) when it was trading at $2 a share, I took his call seriously. (VirnetX is now trading between $35 to $40 a share.) Before I could finish my due diligence, however, the now famous Tech Crunch article came out and Vringo's stock price tripled. I was frustrated that I couldn't get in at $1, so I kept waiting for the share price to fall back. It never did.

Message.Msg: Re: MGM & LionsGate AND YouTube Dominance in 2010 2-Nov-10 10:47 pm Mark Cuban He was aided by Mark Cuban, who sold his 5.4 percent stake in the company to Icahn in June for $7 a share, after Lions Gate told Cuban another buyer was willing to pay more, according to the complaint. Icahn today denied having any “side deals” with Cuban. He said Lions Gate’s claims based on information from unidentified sources are “insufficient to warrant further inquiry.”

John Ford from seakibgalpha 97% of Google's revenue in the United States comes from the company's search engines. During the last six years, Google has generated $67 billion while using Vringo patents.

Topic.Title: Google Buys On2 ceo and bod

Message.Msg: Google Settlement Could Drive Vringo Shares Above $30 July 23, 2012 John Ford from seekingalpha Everything depends on whether or not Vringo can win this case. Keep reading, and I will explain why I think Vringo will prevail. First off, I see five possible outcomes as a result of this lawsuit: Number one: Vringo wins in court and receives damages and future royalties. Number two: Google wins, and Vringo shares immediately lose most of their value. Number three: Google buys Vringo before the trial. Number four: Google settles with Vringo before the trial. Number five: Microsoft, Yahoo, or any number of big players buy Vringo.

Message.Msg: Winners and losers in the Microsoft-Skype deal WINNER: Facebook kept Skype off Google's hands without having to shell a penny Winners and losers in the Microsoft-Skype deal Many of the big players in technology have either won or lost as a result of the tie-up With the news that Microsoft will acquire Skype for over $8 billion including debt, the question becomes: Who are the winners and losers? Google was probably never really interested in buying Skype.[just nonesense from reporter; casp321. Google was waiting to complete ON2/Hantro deal before being able to get its handa on Skype: Jan 27, 2009 is the clear evidence of how ON2 BOD was trying to benefit from Google acquisition of Skype by getting their bonuses the same day, Jan 27, 2009, as the Rumor of Google might be acquiring Skype]
